thread.title: Roy Keane's 5 best Arsenal put-downs from slamming "weak" players to blasting Arsene Wenger's decisions
thread.title_full: Roy Keane's 5 best Arsenal put-downs from slamming "weak" players to blasting Arsene Wenger's decisions

author: Jake Polden
title: Roy Keane's 5 best Arsenal put-downs from slamming "weak" players to blasting Arsene Wenger's decisions
text:
Bayern Munich hammered Arsenal 5-1 at the Allianz Arena last night. 
The result means the Gunners are all but out of the Champions League at the Round of 16 - a familiar story for supporters of the north London club. 
But it's not the only thing that Arsenal fans will be familiar with, as the above video shows. 
The clip features five memorable occasions Roy Keane - who isn't one to mince his words at the best of times - has well and truly slammed the club. 
From questioning Arsene Wenger's decisions, to picking out individual players for criticism, to slamming the club as a whole... it's all here. "Did you think they'd go to Bayern Munich and get a result?" 
The Manchester United legend claimed he had already called it after Arsenal's capitulation on Wednesday night, while analysing the game on ITV's Champions League Highlights show. 
"I'm not surprised," Keane said. "Did you think they'd go to Bayern Munich and get a result? 
"We've said it before, though. Lack of leaders, lack of characters, hunger, desire. Roy Keane often has a lot to say about Arsenal (Photo: ITV) 
"But I have to say, tonight at this level, this stage of the competition, they're just not good enough. 
"So there's no point in being too critical of them, because they're not good enough. 
"They've only got two decent players. The rest, average." "When I see Gibbs with the captain's armband on... you're in trouble." 
Keane was very critical of Wenger's decision to hand Kieran Gibbs the captain's armband in the second half of their Champions League clash with Munich. 
The wing-back was named skipper after Laurent Koscielny limped off after 49 minutes - moments before the game was turned on its head. 
Gibbs endured a tough time at the Allianz Arena - arguably his best contribution was illegally saving a ball off the line with his hand. The Man United legend was critical of the decision to name Kieran Gibbs captain (Photo: Rex Features) 
And Keane was less than impressed with his ability to rally his troops as the result became increasingly embarrassing. 
"When I see Gibbs with the captain's armband on at the end of the game, you're in trouble, said the ex-united midfielder. "We will see half the Arsenal players with their gloves on." 
Back in September 2016, Keane actually had a few positive things to say about the Gunners, before he quickly amended his tone. 
Arsenal had just beaten Basel 2-0 in the Champions League, but the Irishman predicted the positivity would soon come to a head. Keane hit out at the Gunners players for wearing gloves (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
At the time he told ITV: "When they are in that form and have that possession, they are great to watch. They could have scored seven, eight, nine goals easily - a joy to watch. 
"But the crunch games are coming up for them over the next few months, when the cold nights come in and we will see half the Arsenal players with their gloves on." "They're soft. They're weak." 
Keane had a lot to say about Arsenal back in October 2015, after they were beaten 3-2 by Olympiacos in the Champions League. 
At the time he picked out David Ospina for particular criticism, asking why he was selected to start over regular keeper Petr Cech. 
"They're soft. They're weak," said the Irishman. The Irishman picked out David Ospina for criticism back in October 2015 (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) 
"The goals they give away â€” you saw [on the] night, two set-pieces again. 
"You've got no chance of winning any big game if you defend like that. 
"There is a certain weakness to the group. They look like they lack characters, leaders and winners." "They're more interested in selfies and six packs." 
Back in August 2015, when Arsenal were preparing for the new season, getting ready to stun Liverpool on the opening day, Keane had a few things to say. 
In an interview with Ireland's Sunday World newspaper, he suggested that Gunners players were far too "interested in [taking] selfies". 
He claimed that it was this 'addiction' - for want of a better word - that was standing in their way of winning a Premier League title. Keane suggested Arsenal were more interested in selfies than winning games (Photo: twitter) 
"It's all about how their bodies look, how their hair is, more so than winning football matches, which is the way things are going," Keane said at the time. 
"They've got good players, really good players, it's just one or two of their players, they're more interested in selfies and six packs." poll loading What should Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger do? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
